snippet: Pope Francis’ remarks to a distraught little boy whose dog had died have caused a new debate on whether animals have souls, suffer and go to heaven.
abstract: Pope Francis, in public remarks, supports notion that animals can participate in a spiritual afterlife; assuring little boy whose dog had died that all creatures can know 'paradise,' Francis stirs debate on whether animals have souls; theologians caution that Francis was not making a doctrinal statement, but many see remarks as repudiation of conservative Catholic theology.
lead_paragraph: Pope Francis’ remarks to a distraught little boy whose dog had died have caused a new debate on whether animals have souls, suffer and go to heaven.

headline.main: Dogs in Heaven? Pope Francis Leaves Pearly Gates Open
headline.print_headline: Dogs in Heaven? Pope Leaves Pearly Gate Open
